basic.floral_language:
Mahonia fortunei
Floriography: peculiar, brave, enterprising
Mahonia fortunei is evergreen with elegant plant shape and beautifully bizarre obovate leaves with spikes on leaf margins. High ornamental value, usually used for flower beds or potted plants for home environment.
Likes half shaded environments, avoid direct sunlight in summer, expose to 2-3 hours sunlight in winter. Bloom in July-September with yellow flowers.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers in July-September, yellow flowers

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes half shade environments, in summer avoid direct strong light, in winter take 2-3h sunlight
maintenance.watering: Moderately resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn
